summary: This script reads the contents of SEED file line by line using a bash loop and assigns each line to variable "i". It then outputs each line, likely for further processing or analysis.

details.comment: This script reads the contents of SEED file line by line using a bash loop and assigns each line to variable "i". It then outputs each line, likely for further processing or analysis.
details.content:
#!/bin/bash
#kern=$(cat SEED)
#echo $kern
# that is not. i need to read line by line.
#read -d ADDR <<< "$kern"
IFS=$'\n' read -d '' -r -a lines < SEED
for i in "${lines[@]}";
do
	echo $i
done
